name: Dark Alliance Cinematic Launch
description: Created FX setups and ran shots for all of the bow & arrow FX, dragon breath, and balista destruction. Created a procedural ground kickup setup for artists to run over all the characters.

name: Hey, the bug lady’s here. And she’s not here for a play date.
responsibilities: Procedural yarn thread generation tool for mouth shapes
Procedural felt tool for better integration
description: Created tools for procedurally generating photo-realistic, art-directable CG thread and felt. Animators provided simple curves, and lighters had control over thread plies, twisting, color, fray, frizz, and profile. A felt layer was used to help get nice shadow interaction where the thread meets the live-action Sheep and Moon crafts.

name: Flat Matthew Super Bowl LV
responsibilities: Cloth Rig R&D for the Kimmel suit
description: Created the cloth FX setup for Flat Matthew's suit worn on the Jimmy Kimmel section and onward.

name: Season 8 - Mayhem
description: Created a library of ground blasts and instanced them around. Created tools for easily placing and timing blasts along a curve, randomly scattered, or by clicking on some environment geometry. Also added destruction and fire FX for the ship careening into the rockface.

name: Season 7 - Ascension
responsibilities: Procedural Hovercraft Thruster & Environment Interaction FX R&D and Setup
description: Created a setup control the thrusters on the hovercraft, as well as its ground interaction. Thruster intensity is controlled by the hovercraft's acceleration and direction, keeping it pretty automated/procedural for when the animation was updated.

name: Season 6 - Boosted
description: Probably my favorite Apex spot to work on, but also the most challenging since the whole thing is in reverse and full of time ramps! Created the Amped Wall FX, a splurt of Caustic's green smoke, and all the FX inside the gun barrel/chamber as the bullet flies through.

name: Season 4 - Assimilation
description: Created cloth FX rigs for all the characters.

name: Season 3 - Meltdown
description: A few smaller one-off FX in this one: sparks, muzzle flashes, Wattson's electricity again, Crypto's drone trails, drone EMP, and gibraltar's shield.

name: Season 2 - Battle Charge
description: Created the stylized lightning and electricity setup for the aptly-name Wattson character. Did some blood and a plasma bullet hit on Octane, and ran some ground kickup for characters running around the environment.

name: Beyond Light Reveal Trailer
responsibilities: Cloth and Fur FX R&D, Setup, and Shot Execution
description: Created all cloth and fur CFX setups, and ran all the shots. Wrote a pipeline tool to listen to ftrack for updated animation caches and automatically up-version and send a new hipfile to our farm to pre-cache proxy geometry, sim cloth & fur, publish caches, test render, and submit to our review system (Pre-PDG).

name: What's Your Warrior?
description: Cell was made up of thousands of tiny little procedurally generated worm-like objects, and instanced onto a stretchy grain sim. In the background, there are hundreds of other instanced cells splitting, with wispy particle sims just like the hero. Instanced Arnold procedurals made rendering them all together a breeze.

name: The Art of Fast
description: Volumetric tornado sim and Mantra lighting/rendering.

name: Famous Cars
description: All animation and FX on the growing pumpkin shots, including animated mask, grass setup, growing vines into wheels, pixie dust etc. Super fun!

name: Green Means Go
description: Modeled a couple of oceans and did some kickup spray and digital transformation FX. The challenging part of this spot is that the biker was shot 100% in camera, no digi-double. So instead of matching a rider to an ocean from FX, we matched the ocean to the tracked animation of the rider!

name: OptiPlex 7070 Ultra (2019)
description: All the lines are created and animated procedurally inside Houdini. After building a few HDAs for the show, it was easy to generate and animate cool sketchlines for any set piece the art direction called for.

name: Butterflies
description: Created a particle system to animate the flying butters. Flapping is a looping cache from the Animation department that was cycled on each particle.

name: Zen Apartment
description: Grain sim to pour sand out from the shoe, as well as the closet dump.

name: QLED 8K Launch Film
description: Mountain forming sim seen in the thumbnail. Base simulation was mostly done by another artist. I setup the rock generation, instancing and blending, and rendering of deep image planes for comp.

name: Run it
description: Added CG Snow to places where it wasn't snowy enough.

name: Feel Something Again
description: Added lingering environment smoke and well as some tire burnout smoke as the car travels backwards.
